Reviews.Title: “Great value and location, average breakfast & service”
Reviews.Author: Dawn W
Reviews.Content: Great value and in central location for seeing Istanbul--we walked everywhere from the hotel. Was disappointed because the hotel's website said that the view from my parents' room was of the Blue Mosque. But when we arrived, a building was being constructed directly behind their balcony that blocked the view. The room my family of four stayed in was nice--the kids slept on a pull out couch in the entry room. Our double bed was in a second, fairly spacious room. The noise from the street was a bit distracting at night. The breakfast was good, but not nearly as extensive as the one I had on my previous visit at the Sebnam Hotel or the one we later had in Cappadocia at the Kelebek Hotel. The lobby, breakfast and hallways were all in need of repairs, painting, etc. The breakfast seating area had open doors that looked out over the road, which was nice. The staff was helpful making suggestions about nearby restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place”
Reviews.Author: masar23
Reviews.Content: I was there in Sept '06. Very nice place, location, and best of all : the staff. I'd give it 5-star on the value-for-money scale.Everyone was pleasant and helpful. The owner is probably the friendliest guy I've met. Breakfast was amazing, in terms of food available and the view. Made my stay in Instanbul just that much more special. p/s: Sorry for the "delayed" review ;)

Reviews.Title: “absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: arakis1ru
Reviews.Content: Hakan, the owner, one of the most wonderful and decent human beings I have ever met. I ended up travelling alone (something I was initially very nervous about) and he made sure I had near the best time of my life while in Istanbul (though it was a pretty short trip on my way to Spain). I was picked up at the airport promptly and taken to the hotel where I was greeted like one of their dearest guests. Turkish people are one of the most hard working and friendly people out there. Hakan and his staff are helpful and endlessly wonderful. I stayed at the appartments and -being somewhat direction challenged- they made sure I can find my way around (although the location of the hotel is genious). When needed, they would gladly come to rescue:) They secured me most terrific tour guide who was very knowledgeable, friendly, pleasant and just very cool. I absolutely LOVED Istanbul and would go back in a heart beat. When one received the way I was received/treated at the Apricot hotel it's impossible not to fall in love with the people and the place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice views and good location”
Reviews.Author: veedubmelb
Reviews.Content: This is a small, well located hotel - more like a guesthouse than a hotel, as it only has half a dozen rooms in the main building plus two apartments with are down the road (5 - 10 mins walk). We stayed in one of the apartments which was very nice - a great sea view which is a good way to appreciate Istanbul as one of the world's great harbour cities, and it also gives a bit more privacy than I imagine the main hotel would have. The hot water in the apartment ran out very quickly, but reheated equally quickly so was only a minor irritation (you might not notice if you're not one for long hot showers like me - or if you visit at a different time of the year, since it's usually hot in Turkey anyway). As might be expected from such a small hotel, the owner takes a personal interest in every guest and he checked with us more than once that all was well. We were partly attracted to this hotel because it shows up on a Google as one of relatively few that are gay friendly, and our experience bore this out (they didn't bat an eyelid at two men sharing a double). The breakfast offered a good selection and they bring you fresh OJ (out of an orange, not out of a bottle). Happy to recommend this place for anyone wanting a convenient central location to visit Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Home”
Reviews.Author: Busy-retired
Reviews.Content: We have spent many nights in the Apricot Hotel in the past five years. All of them have been excellent, and the month we spent there in November of 2011 was no exception. We like the spacious "two room" concept of Room One. We love the room arrangement, the comfortable bed and the luxurious and large bathroom. Breakfast is simply outstanding. Orange juice is squeezed freshly for you when you arrive at the breakfast. There is a wide variety of breads, cheeses, meats and an excellent arrangement of olives. Add tomatoes and cucumbers, fresh eggs, yogurt, dried and fresh fruit and cereal and you have many breakfast choices. US guests will appreciate the brewed coffee, which is not easy to find in Istanbul. I can not say enough about the staff of the Apricot. My husband was ill almost all of the time we were in Istanbul, and spent many days right in bed. He received better care from the staff of the hotel than he did in the ultra-modern hospital where he went when we returned from Istanbul. Hakan, the owner, was very concerned for the welfare of my husband. He obtained medicine for him, and offered to take him to a doctor and/or hospital many times. He checked on our status several times each day. The incomparable Ayse is just amazing. She prepares and serves breakfast, keeps all the rooms clean and tidy, and provides lots of hugs and smiles making you feel totally at home. In our case she took special care of my husband. She provided medication, and on several occasions brought food she had made at home that she hoped would tempt his appetite. On those days that we ventured outside she made sure he was warmly dressed, buttoning his coat and making sure he had on a hat. We could simply not have received warmer or more comprehensive service. We arrived only a few hours after Lynn, a partner in the hotel, had passed away, and we all missed her vibrant personality. Fortunately, while the staff was grieving, there was no slip in the outstanding service. We like Room One in the main hotel, but if I were able to walk a few more blocks I would look seriously at the Seaside Flats also offered by the Apricot. These little self-catering jewels have good sized balconies with outstanding views of the Sea of Marmara. The design and decoration of these rooms is exceptionally well done. Because my husband was ill I did more entertaining in the lobby this year than ever before. The staff was gracious to all of my guests, providing beverages and cookies. Even if we stayed up very late there were no objections. Much of the original hotel has received new wall paper, and the Wi-fi worked perfectly during all of our stay. I also appreciated the assistance of the young men who worked the night reception desk. They were very helpful in ordering meals delivered to me, and they even tracked down some "US style" chicken noodle soup. Being ill on a vacation is not the way we would select to spend our time in Istanbul, but if one has to be ill, the staff at the Apricot could not take better care of you. I simply cannot imagine a visit to Istanbul without staying in the Apricot.

Reviews.Title: “Location Loction”
Reviews.Author: YukonJohann
Reviews.Content: Great location, Room, Service, and Breakfast.............

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Irene S
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a wonderful position, very close to the many historical and religious sites of the city center. The rooms are clean, nicely furnished, very warm in the winter and they are cleaned every single day. The brakfast is exceptional: fresh orange juice, Turkish tea, local jams and honeys, dried and fresh fruits, cheeses and hams..everything very tasty! The personnel is extremely nice and ready to give you any information you might need during your staying. Friendly and cozy place!!! To try again!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of bait and switch”
Reviews.Author: Irving K
Reviews.Content: Before leaving Istanbul, we reserved room 4 at the Apricot for our return trip. At their request, we gave them a cash deposit. When we arrived two weeks later, they had given the room to someone else. The room they gave had cracks in the wall, no shower curtain, and the soap dispenser was empty. They said they had no refill. The curtain didn't reach the bottom of the window, and there was an intermittent loud beeping noise that kept us awake all night. When we checked out the next morning, they tried to charge us for the following night because our original reservation (the one they gave away) was for two nights. We went to the Sari Konac around the corner for our last night. It was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and close to the Blue Mosque”
Reviews.Author: KKBailie
Reviews.Content: The Apricot Hotel was a great place to stay while exploring the city of Istanbul. The staff was patient as we asked questions in broken Turkish and assisted us with planning trips around the city by providing maps and directions to help us navigate public transportation. Each morning their is a large selection of items in the complementary breakfast and the staff is very attentive with refills for your cup of coffee or tea. We stayed in room 3, which was the smallest, but ideal for our budget and the short amount of time we spent in the room (sleeping only). The hotel was clean and the staff graciously responded to all of our requests.

Reviews.Title: “Inspect the room before checking in!”
Reviews.Author: Joel R
Reviews.Content: Our room at the Apricot Hotel was a real disappointment. It was tiny, with very little space to put things, but that was tolerable. Less acceptable was the thick coating of dust on top of the wardrobe, where glasses on a tray had been placed. The bathroom was disaster: a shower door with a large gap at the bottom so the floor was always flooded, holes in the wall with exposed plumbing, an electrical plate that didn't completely cover a hole in the wall so that there was exposed wiring, metal screws protruding from the wall (included 2 with rusty, sharp points right over the sink), and a dark substance like dust or mold covering the hair dryer power cord. Because of all this, we left the hotel early to move to better accommodations elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the stay and hospitality. Positively recommended!”
Reviews.Author: vagabondhart
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Apricot with two other friends while visiting Turkey in July. We came across the hotel while searching for decent, inexpansive accomodations and instantly fell for it. Though the rooms are not very big, but they are clean, and very tastefully done. The entire place has the feel a homely feel, in the sense of hand picked, tasteful decorations and interiors and almost luxurious bathrooms ! On the second occasion we could not get the booking in the hotel but we were so enamoured with the hospitality and the friendly and knowledgeable hostess and staff that we wanted to just stay with them and so gave their flat a try. We were glad we did. For the three of us it was a perfect place, with a great view from the balcony as well as litttle, kitchenette, complete with a dining table and few utensils. The only drawback some might find in the flat is that the staircase is a bit narrow and there are two flights of stairs. But the flat iself is again tastefully done, comfortable and secure. I am sure I'll go back again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “An alternative to chain hotels in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: peachykean
Reviews.Content: We saw great reviews on TripAdvisor and decided to give it a go in stead of staying at a chain hotel. Room(s): We decided to rent the flat (they have 2 for rent) a bottom and top flats. (the second story flat is a private residence) Top Flat - Great room, a double bed, sitting area, great window, bath and view of the Marmara Sea. The flat was well decorated and very clean. If you needed a refrigerator or microwave, you needed to request one a head of time. There is no elevator, there are narrow stairs made of wood. There were various offers to bring our luggage up and down the stairs - It did not seem that were not looking for tips, they just wanted to keep the property maintained and free of scuffs and and avoid denting the walls. Bottom Flat - This was not as clean or as outfitted as the top flat. The floor could of been a bit cleaner, but everything else was clean enough. It seemed that the bottom flat was still in construction mode as we found supplies throughout the flat. Again you needed to request a refrigerator or microwave ahead of time. The back deck looking over the sea was nice, but beware of the wooden bench, it was oozing sap from the wood and I got a bunch of sap over my laptop and pants. It seemed that they just got the bottom flat livable in time for our arrival. Room summary - Overall, not bad (really good deal) given the price that Lynn had set up for us. Considering that both flat were included, we paid less than we would of for a room in a three star rated hotel. Both flats together slept 5, maybe even 6 with the additional mattress. Note to light sleepers - be aware of any hotel in this area of Sultanahmet as there are regular trains coming through. I did not notice them late at night. Location - Location, Location, Location - Wow, the hotel and flat are in Sultanahmet and close walking distance to most attractions. The neighborhood felt very safe and anytime of night or day. The neighborhood had hotels, private residences and even some KÄ±raathanes. Staff - Great -This is what can make or break things, and the staff made our stay very nice. I'm sorry that I was not able to meet Lynn, but Hakkan, John and everyone else was very friendly and helpful. We tipped them often, but I don't think that it was expected, but very appreciated. Breakfast - Included with the room; coffee, tea, water, fresh squeezed orange juice, jams, bread, sandwich meat, spreads, boiled eggs, vegetables and a couple different cereals. Very sufficient for a small boutique hotel. If you are looking for an experience of living close to the way a Turk may live, and not rely on major chains, I would recommend this property. I would stay there again as it was worth the value.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice little place and very affordable!”
Reviews.Author: mrt77
Reviews.Content: Great little place right in the historic old down district, easy walking distance to Blue Mosque, Haggia Sophia, etc. Lynn Yeomen there is from Hawaii and is very good and helpful, plus a great contact for Americans. Recommended good shopping, restaurants, places to see and avoid, etc. Plus its got to be about the best deal in that area, we paid 89 euros a night!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ArizonamikeC
Reviews.Content: It's always interesting to read Trip Advisor reviews and then try to determine (based on the good and bad reviews of the exact same place) whether it's a good choice for you. Well the Apricot Hotel was the perfect hotel for my wife and I and our 22 year old son. Lynn is the perfect host (she was travelling in Istanbul a few years ago, loved it so much, she now runs this hotel with her partner Hakan). First of all, they pick you up from the aiport! Amazing service for an 8-room hotel. Then, when we arrive, Lynn sits us down, serves us Turkish tea and coffee and goes over maps of the city and interesting places to explore, eat, etc. We stayed in the Seaside house which is a 10 minute walk from the main building - great balcony and view of the Marmara sea. All the furniture was hand picked or hand made; price was very reasonable (around $150 per night for big apartment with kitchen, easily accommodating 3 of us). As some folks have pointed out, the train tracks are below, but in 3 nights, I never remember the train bothering us. We were 5 minutes from the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia, 15 minutes from the Grand Bazaar, so a perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “A most excellent experience!”
Reviews.Author: Billyorktown
Reviews.Content: You can pay more for accommodations, but not get more in that Lynn, Ayse and the boys offer excellent, knowledgeable and most important - friendly service. Breakfast is a delight and the location in the Old City is perfect - just down the hill from the Sultanahmet. There is a comfortable feeling as if you have been there before and you have known them for years. Thank-you!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, value & host”
Reviews.Author: nryan33
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights on a far too quick trip in Istanbul. Great city and the Apricot hotel was a great place to stay. Lynn is a great host and make sure and heed her great suggestions esp. the local baths and the fish market for lunch. This place is in the perfect location, was good value in Istanbul and the breakfast was great. We stayed in the apartments which are a few minutes down the road but breakfast is served in the hotel each morning. These apartments are small but have a nice balcony overlooking the sea and the walk to the hotel each morning was nice. There is some noice from the train below but it's not bad. Overall this is the kind of homely place I always like to stay in while travelling.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and helpful service, good location, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Discowilly
Reviews.Content: Fantastic friendly and helpful service set this hotel apart from many others. The house (not the hotel) is over a railway line so yes, you get some train noise, but actually there arent many trains and the view over the Sea of Marmara is magnificent. Rooms are large, free wifi, fridge, coffee machine, kettle, ensuite.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: nyctraveler11215
Reviews.Content: Lynn and her staff were a delight. My husband and I could not have asked for a more wonderful experience. We were picked up at the airport as scheduled. The breakfasts were delicious, the rooms were clean and beautifully decorated and the location was a short stroll to all the major sights. All and all we could not recommend this hotel more highly. Lynn puts a personal,loving touch on all that she does!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hospitality”
Reviews.Author: swimref
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Apricot Hotel was like staying with friends. We were met at the airport as promised. The airport is a bit of a scrum so do as Lynn tells you to and do not leave the building, we did not find our ride immediately but stayed put until we connected with him. We were welcomed with tea on arrival and then Lynn gave us info on sights to see in Istanbul, lent us a Rick Steves guide book and then walked us up the street to a restaurant she recommended. The location is wonderful as it is walking distance to all the sights in Istanbul yet it is on a quiet street. Breakfast is included and is the best we had in Turkey. Lots of variety and very fresh, also lots of good coffee, not Nescafe which a lot of places give you. Even on the morning when we had a 4:30 am shuttle pick up breakfast was put ready for us and one of the staff got up at 4 to make us coffee. The same one, Merhir (spelling?) that lent us his own laptop when the hotel one was busy. The hotel was a little chaotic due to redecorating while we were there but the staff always met out needs and now it should be all lovely and new again. The honesty of the hotel became apparent when we got an email prior to our arrival from Lynn stating the season was late starting so offering us a room upgrade or a reduction in price to low season rates. If you want a 5 star American hotel go elsewhere, if you want a charming, friendly, conveniently located place then go to the Apricot Hotel. The staff felt like friends and as Lynn is American born it is helpful to have some one there that speaks English and knows the tips to help you around Turkey.

Reviews.Title: “Like staying with good cousins”
Reviews.Author: frankCien
Reviews.Content: I wish all the places I ever stay at would have the same convivial, helpful and genuinely friendly attitude. Each morning at breakfast Goksel or Cem would come over and show an interest in our day, ask us our plans then suggest the best ways to do what we planned. They would also suggest extra things to do in the part of Istanbul we were planning to visit. Goksel is a treasure of information. He grew up in the town of Gallipoli and used to run tours there. He also knows a great deal about Istanbul. The rooms are nice, the breakfasts are simple but tasty and you can eat till you pop. Each day we enjoyed a buffett table of creamy feta cheese and also regular cheese, basil leaves, tomato and salad, slices of sausage, olives, fresh bread rolls, coffee, tea and fruit juices. The hotel is in 2 parts, each a few side streets apart from the other. The location of both parts of the hotel is very convenient to the old, historic part of the city. The original part is a converted 19th century 2 storey house in one of the fascinating, winding back streets. The newer part of the hotel is a few streets away and is part of an old, character apartment that had been recently renovated. We were given the option of which part to stay. We chose the newer part because the rooms were bigger and the bedroom had a cute balcony with good views across the Sea of Marmara and the dozens of ships lying at anchor. Its true that there was a rail line below our balcony but it was barely noticable as the rail line is in a very deep cutting. The exotic views across the Sea of Marmara more than made up for it. Each morning we enjoyed a 5 or 10 minute fascinating walk to the main part of the hotel where breakfast was served and where we could be sure to have a happy chat with Goksel, Cem and other guests. At the end of our stay Cem showed us how to find the bus depot for our journey to Bulgaria arranged for a good taxi driver to deliver us there. Staying at the Hotel Apricot was a pleasure. It was laid back, unpretentious and very happy as well as clean. It was like staying with cousins who want to see you have a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, amazing hospitality, fabulous experience”
Reviews.Author: Rumesha
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Apricot hotel for 5 nights in February 2011.Thoughts below Location - central and very easy to navigate through the Old City area. The Blue Mosque, Aya Sofya and Topkapi Palace are within a 5 minutes walk, Grand Bazaar is a 10 minutes walk away and the tram (5 minutes walk) connects you easily through the rest of the city. The only drawback for the partying folks is that most of the nightlife options are in the newer part of Istanbul which is a tram ride and funicular stop away. Hotel - charming boutique hotel. Rooms are adequately sized and come with large (for European standards) and clean bathrooms. We stayed in 2 rooms, one which came with a luxurious jacuzzi bathtub. Partial views of the Blue Mosque. Hotel has wi-fi capabilities (in the rooms as well). The breakfast was fabulous - daily spread includes meats, cheeses, eggs, fruits, cereal, granola, yogurt, jams, breads, vegetables, nuts, freshly squeezed orange juice and choices of tea and coffee. Hospitality - cannot wax eloquent enough. The staff (Hakan, Lynn, Maahir, Ayeshe) were knowledegable, gracious and always willing to help with great dining, sightseeing and shopping recommendations. Lynn and Maahir were particularly considerate and were quick to offer us tea/coffee at all times of the day. We genuinely enjoyed engaging with the staff Recommendation - if your primary objective is to see the sights and enjoy the dining/shopping treasures of Istanbul, I cannot think of a better place to stay. If you stay at the Apricot, you will have a wonderful experience in Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “What To Write When The Best Gets Better?”
Reviews.Author: Busy-retired
Reviews.Content: The Apricot has been our home in Istanbul for four years, and we have spent hundreds of nights there. We love Hakan. He is a gracious host with a wealth of information and he is always happy to help you plan your adventures in Istanbul. Recently Lynn became a co-owner of the Apricot. I thought everything was perfect prior to this change, but I was wrong. The best hotel got even better with the synergy these two people provide to every guest. Together they are better than the sum of their parts. Lynn brings a rare level of enthusiasm to the hotel. I looked forward to waking up every morning so I could walk down the stairs and hear her laughter and listen to her stories. She is vibrant and dynamic and makes sure you enjoy your experience. She loves Istanbul, and it is impossible to talk to her and not catch that energy yourself. Ayse, the hotel maid, is a treasure. She literally waited on us hand and foot. I had recently had hip surgery and could not put on my own shoes. She pushed my husband out of the way and insisted that she do it herself. The other staff members are just as enthusiastic. Lynn's attitude is contagious. She really will send a staff member with you if you are not certain of where you are going. Our daughter visited us during the last week of our stay in Istanbul. She enjoys a brisk walk early in the morning. Every morning she was accompanied by a hotel staff member, who not only kept her company on her walk but also provided a wealth of information on everything they passed along the way. Using some rare sixth sense, it seemed like every time we got off of the tram to return to the hotel there was someone from the hotel to meet us and carry our packages home. If I said "What are you doing here?" the response was always "looking for you". Breakfast is completely amazing. From fresh eggs to a huge variety of outstanding breads, to the selection of olives, the thick yogurt, the cherry preserves, the goat cheese, often produced from the goats the hotel owns on property south of Istanbul, the fresh vegetables and fruits, and, of course, the remarkable freshly squeezed orange juice. I really miss my normal Apricot breakfast of tomatoes, cucumbers, carrots, olives, yogurt, simmit, soft-boiled egg and whatever fruits are in season. This is the only meal I ever eat that provides seven servings of fruits and vegetables in a single meal. Breakfast entertainment is even better than the food. Lynn makes sure that guests are introduced to one another, and then it is inevitable that you exchange information and experiences with your fellow travelers. Lynn and Hakan are so interesting that it is always difficult for us to leave the hotel on our daily adventures. We really did spend a couple of days in the hotel without leaving it. We had a couple of days when we were not feeling well. Ayse brought us food and beverages and Hakan ordered our evening meals from good neighborhood restaurants. It is not a five star property, and there might be a bit of fraying around the edges, but the building rings with laughter and energy and embraces you. The room rates are among the lowest in the neighborhood, and such low prices permit us to spend at least a month in the hotel. If you sacrifice the trappings of a five star hotel, they are more than compensated by the amazing level of service we receive. The hotel enjoys an excellent location in Sultanahmet. All the historical sites are within easy walking distance. The property is only one block away from a street that is very busy with many restaurant choices. Yet, the hotel itself is located on a tiny quiet street. I find the views of other quaint little boutique hotels to be quite charming from my room in the hotel. We never travel without both of our laptops and the Wifi connection is great. The TV provides a limited number of English speaking programs, but my husband is totally addicted to some series from the UK. I enjoy CNN International. In addition to the main building the hotel also offers a couple of small apartments. These rooms are jewels. They offer amazing views of the Sea of Marmara. Every item in each room has been carefully selected from the hand-blown glass fixtures to the custom made draperies. These Seaside Flat rooms provide a high level of luxury, and are both charming and romantic. I have never felt more "at home" anywhere than I feel at the Apricot. From the minute I see my name on a sign at the airport to the last breakfast, which is prepared and waiting for me when I depart at an unreasonably early hour, every minute we spend here is lovely, charming and pleasant. Were I to win the lottery I would simply move into room one and live in the hotel full-time. We miss every day that we are away from Istanbul. I wished I could give it six stars because that is what it deserves.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, fantastic service & great Turkish hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Keyamom
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for our entire stay in Istanbul & we had a great time with not much to complain about. We travelled with our 22 month old daughter & Hakkan, Lynn & the rest of the staff went out of their way to ensure that our daughter had a comfortable stay and a great time there! The hotel is so close to all the major attractions, yet it's on a reasonably quiet street. The room was well appointed & reasonably sized and the bathroom was spacious & all marbled, with a shower as well as a Turkish bath (my daughter loved the Turkish bath!). Hakkan & Lynn (English is not a problem here as both of them are fluent) were great hosts & we relied a lot on their advise in terms of where to eat, entertainment options, buying stuff & generally not getting cheated! It would be unfair to compare them to 5 star hotels - Apricot offers great value for money! We'll definitely stay there again on our next visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: eak027
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights at the end of a 4 week vacation in Turkey. This hotel is in a wonderful location- walking distance from the main tourist sites and yet a fairly quiet street. Hakan and Lynn are very helpful with planning your day and restaurant suggestions. Hubby and I were rather " touristed out " by this point in our vacation and spent a fair amount of time hanging out in the dining room with our Notebook and a cup of tea. We did not feel pressured to stay in our rooms, and after a while it felt like we were family! Breakfast was delicious; best yogurt I tasted in Turkey and freshly squeezed orange juice! Lynn said that they are attempting an Organic breakfast. The room was very large and the bathroom was huge! Were things perfect? Of course not, but I chose this hotel because it fit our budget and I was not disappointed. If you want American/Canadian style hotels, stay home!

Reviews.Title: “The Apricot is More Than a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marg41
Reviews.Content: The Apricot is more than a hotel. As soon as you arrive, the friendly co-owner, Lynn unfolds a map and shows you everything within walking distance, because EVERYTHING is within walking distance from this location. And if you think you canâ€™t find something, Lynn will make sure you do â€“ sheâ€™ll ask one of the staff to lead you there, as she did with us. The staff was exceptional and friendly. The rooms were spotless, welcoming, and the bathroom was especially nice. We stayed in the apartments because our son was with us and we had plenty of room with a view of the Bosphorus and a lovely patio. Even though we werenâ€™t IN the hotel (we were blocks away), I preferred this for its privacy and the lovely walk to and from breakfast. The breakfast was fantastic â€“ freshly squeezed orange juice (they start squeezing oranges the minute you walk in), breads, soft-boiled eggs, cereals, a virtual deli spread (donâ€™t miss the goat cheese) and fantastic apricots (but of course), and figs. The room is cozy and you get a chance to chat with other really interesting travelers, only if you want. One quiet, memorable moment: just sitting by the open window near a blooming bougainvillaea, watching the cats and people walk by. Owners Lynn and Hakan were always â€œupâ€� and eager to help out â€“ Hakan has connections with rug merchants, tile people, restaurants â€“ virtually everyone in the city, so, if you ask, he can send you to the places he thinks youâ€™ll like. They really see to everything, plus they have a shuttle service to and from the airport. We felt so well cared for. The Apricot is unlike any other place weâ€™ve stayed and we would return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff, Beautiful Hotel, Excellent Location - Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: patster66
Reviews.Content: Trip Advisor Review of The Apricot Hotel The Apricot Hotel is a relaxing, beautifully-operated boutique hotel in the Sultanahmet District in Istanbul, just a few minutes walk from everything youâ€™ll want to see or do in that area, including the Hagia Sophia, Topkopi Palace, The Blue Mosque, The Hippodrome, Fish Market and many great shops and restaurants. Itâ€™s co-owned by a Turkish man (Hakan), and an American woman (Lynn) which is an advantage for English-speaking guests, and itâ€™s the best value as far as price and accommodations go in the area. The service staff are excellent â€“ always ready to meet your needs with a smile. On several occasions, Lynn sent one of their staff with us on excursions just to make sure we got to where we were going â€“ itâ€™s that sort of extra effort that really makes the hotel special. We stayed in the apartment with the seaside view and it was perfect for three people. The bathroom is modern and clean, and the room has its own terrace with a view of the sea. The apartment is a bit of a walk from the hotel, but itâ€™s not more than 10 minutes and you get to see more of Istanbul! We will definitely return to spend more time in Istanbul and weâ€™ll definitely stay at The Apricot Hotel. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great service”
Reviews.Author: chris19531955
Reviews.Content: The positives of this hotel far outweigh the negatives. Positives:- 1. Excellent management (Lynn a former American) and customer service eg. when a last-minute booking for a return visit went astray, Lynn checked other nearby hotels to find us accommodation for us nearby. 2. The breakfast - superior to any other breakfasts we had in out Turkey stay. 3. Location - right next to the Blue Mosque but also in a quiet street. 4. Value for money. Negatives (none are major):- 1. Wi-fi internet doesn't work on the upper floors but it is free and works fine on the ground floor of the hotel. 2. The showers are confusing but the staff will gladly show you how to use them. 3. There are no lifts and the stairs are steep so wouldn't suit some people but my 84 year old father managed. The Apricot Hotel is not 5-star however, I recommend it for someone who wants charm, good value, excellent customer service, a convenient location and great breakfasts.

Reviews.Title: “Not all its cracked up to be...”
Reviews.Author: Korhead
Reviews.Content: Read reviews of the apricot here on trip advisor, that is the reason that we booked at the Apricot. I can tell you that it is only the people who loved it that are commenting here. The hotel was Average at BEST. I have stayed in $1/ a night hotels in Cambodia and I have stayed at $500/ night hotels in London, I have seen the range of quality and price. The Good: The building is in a great neighborhood The overall layout is nice The breakfast was simple but good The owner is very nice and helpful The Bad: Our bathroom had mold and smelled like mold throughout. Electrical fixtures hung hap hazard out of the wall with electrical wires showing No longer a clear line of sight to the Blue Mosque, a building was being erected that obscure your view No rooftop patio or seating (in Turkey this is available everywhere) Goksel (Front desk guy), people seem to love this guy, but he was pretty miserable when we were there. Needs an overhaul, carpets were ripped, paint was pealing, they had a sewer problem while we were there as well. We left a night early as the price of 80 Euros /night, we just didnâ€™t think we were getting our moneys worth. Conclusion: better places to stay for the money, this place is just AVERAGE, not great, not terrible. Keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “My only regret is that Trip Advisor won't allow me to give six stars”
Reviews.Author: EnglandReindeer
Reviews.Content: We really could not have asked for a better place to stay. When we desperately contacted the Apricot Hotel at short notice due to a stay at a terrible hotel nearby, the owners could not have been more helpful. We booked a room immediately, they sent one of the lads by foot to come pick us up (at no charge) and even went across the street to book us a room at a place nearby on the nights on which they were fully booked! The passion of the owners is legendary. The utmost attention to the comfort of their guests is the number-one priority of the hotel manager Lynn and this is obvious. On several occasions during our stay we overheard the managers explaining to each and every guest all of the main sites to see both near and far - their encyclopaedic knowledge of Istanbul is surely enough to fill several guidebooks - and their energy never faltered once. A mere mention to the owners of a desire to have a certain type of cuisine prompted several phone calls to friends and acquaintances, internet searches and recommendations with a long list of options. The staff (including the porters and even the kitchen staff) working at the hotel were unfailingly friendly and greeted every guest with a smile and a "no problem" at every opportunity and to every request. There is no doubt that the Apricot Hotel will be our first and only port of call the next time we are in Istanbul, and we would wholeheartedly recommend it to all.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best service I have ever had!”
Reviews.Author: LostinTransit10
Reviews.Content: Spent a total of 4 nights in the Apricot Hotel and two nights in the apartment (Apricot Seaside) in August, 2010. One adult, and two teens. Here are the highlights: Staff: Extremely helpful. I have stayed in motels and hotels all over Europe, Asia, US/Canada/Alaska/Hawaii, etc and have only one experience that can compare. When my 18 yo son became dehydrated, Lynn (part owner of the hotel) - went to the store for me and bought sick room supplies. Hakan (other owner) went the extra mile helping me track down some hard to find sites in Istanbul. Location: Hard to imagine anything better. Maybe a 5 minute walk to the Blue Mosque. Tram line is also 5 minutes away, which allows travel through out Istanbul. Not sure about parking situation - we did not have a rental car. I would guess it would be tough. Rooms: Small. Very clean. Excellent air conditioning. Excellent mattresses and linen. Wash clothes would be nice, but I brought my own. I must add that the real jewel is the apartment. I was not aware this was even an option until we were staying in the hotel. The cost is higher, but well worth it. You do need to understand that Sultanahmet's streets and may of the buildings are hundreds of years old. It is not laid out like Peoria. We spent the $3 for a cab ride from the hotel to the apartment. After that, it was easy to find our way around. Yes, there is a train that runs by the apartment every 20 minutes or so. But we only heard it during the day. And it was no louder than hearing the Metro rumbling under our $200 a night Paris hotel room. The view of the Bosphorus is outstanding. The rooms are large. I would stay there again in an instant.

Reviews.Title: “WoW - Probably the best service I have ever had!”
Reviews.Author: LostinTransit10
Reviews.Content: Spent a total of 4 nights in the Apricot Hotel and two nights in the apartment (Apricot Seaside) in August, 2010. One adult, and two teens. Here are the highlights: Staff: Extremely helpful. I have stayed in motels and hotels all over Europe, Asia, US/Canada/Alaska/Hawaii, etc and have only one experience that can compare. When my 18 yo son became dehydrated, Lynn (part owner of the hotel) - went to the store for me and bought sick room supplies. Hakan (other owner) went the extra mile helping me track down some hard to find sites in Istanbul. Location: Hard to imagine anything better. Maybe a 5 minute walk to the Blue Mosque. Tram line is also 5 minutes away, which allows travel through out Istanbul. Not sure about parking situation - we did not have a rental car. I would guess it would be tough. Rooms: Small. Very clean. Excellent air conditioning. Excellent mattresses and linen. Wash clothes would be nice, but I brought my own. I must add that the real jewel is the apartment. I was not aware this was even an option until we were staying in the hotel. The cost is higher, but well worth it. Having read one other reviewers post about the apartment - I must set this straight. First, you need to understand that Sultanahmet's streets and may of the buildings are hundreds of years old. It is not laid out like Peoria. We spent the $3 for a cab ride from the hotel to the apartment. After that, it was easy to find our way around. Yes, there is a train that runs by the apartment every 20 minutes or so. But we only heard it during the day. And it was no louder than hearing the Metro rumbling under our $200 a night Paris hotel room. The view of the Bosphorus is outstanding. The rooms are large. I would stay there again in an instant.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: asl22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Apricot for five nights in July and enjoyed our stay very much. The hotel's location in Sultanhamet is very convenient to the main sights, and it's nicely situated on one of the prettier and quieter streets in the area. The thing that stood out most to us, though, was the incredibly friendly staff who really wanted us to enjoy our time in Istanbul and were willing to help with anything. We got many good restaurant and sightseeing recommendations from them. We definitely recommend this hotel if you're looking for a reasonable, small, quiet hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value, wonderful hosts”
Reviews.Author: eaelkins
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights here. It was a perfect location at an excellent price for a verybig city! Our hosts were most helpful and pleasant always eager to provide assistance and suggestions for our visit to Istanbul. The breakfast was particularly good and we often enjoyed a glass of wine in the window seat at the end of a long day of touring.

Reviews.Title: “couldn't wait to leave”
Reviews.Author: cyntul2no
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at the beginning of my trip. this was at first glance what i expected for a hotel in the old quarter. however, my room was not in the hotel. the manager took me to what they call Apricot Seaside. which was a 5-10 minute walk through twisty, turny streets. forget using a map it won't help- the only way to not get lost is use landmarks. so I had to tote my luggage over cobblestones to a remote location where they had remodeled an old house to add a few rooms. mostly the room was nice with a balcony that had a view of the sea but the train track was just below and just beyond that was the freeway so there is a lot of noise. and I wasn;t given a key to the door to the patio so I believe that was unlocked during my visit. A single female was given a ground floor room in a remote house with a door that doesn't lock. when they remodeled they did not make the room sound proof, when people go up the staris, it sounds like they are in the room with you. one night the occupants of the room upstairs came back at 2 am. they used the water, which the plumbing had a problem judgeing by the mold and damage on my ceiling. but the water proceeding to spill out of the ceiling and all over the toilet. I tried to close the door to muffle the sound but the door came off its tracks and got stuck closed so I could not get back into the bathroom all night. the manager did try to help me when one of my tour pickups was forgotten by the operator. however the other guy working was a huge jerk. he was outright rude to me one evening when i asked for a restaurant recommendation. the next morning he had promised to help me with my luggage. Surprise, he did not show up and I had to drag my luggage all the way from this house back to the main hotel to get picked up for my transfer to the airport, and then he was a jerk when I asked him why he didn't show up. The breakfast wasn't much- small selection, bread wasn't very tasty, and served in the tiny lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful and firendly staff, clean rooms, relaxed atmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: Us2inHull
Reviews.Content: Went at the beginning of April for a short stay. The staff at the hotel sorted out a taxi/ minibus to pick us up from the airport and one to take us back again, I would do this again as sorting out taxis ourselves would have stretched our very limited Turkish. Also, this stopped us being ripped off. The young man on the reception desk was extremely helpful and spoke very good English. He annotated a map for us with details about everything from where to buy good baclava to where to catch the local trams and how much they would cost. Breakfast is a buffet in the reception room downstairs where you can watch the world go by. The hotel is situated about 10 min walk form the Blue Mosque and all the other fantastic buildings you have to see. It's a little haven in a very busy and exciting city. Would love to back !

Reviews.Title: “Apricot Hotel is a little gem in the heart of the Sultanamet district of Istambul.”
Reviews.Author: GMFou
Reviews.Content: This is a small 6 bedroom hotel in the heart of the old section of Istambul less than 5 minutes from the Blue Mosque. The rooms are a fair size for Europe with extremely comfortable beds. A good breakfast is included with the room and the staff are very knowledgeable, friendly and provide all the assistance a tourist will needs. The sheets smell wonderful and the air-conditioning keeps everyone cool at night. Each room has it own private bathroom, some with jacuzziz, others with superb showers. Good reasonably priced restaurants are within five minutes of the hotel. Two restaurans by the Cisterns are buffet style offer excellent food at good prices and are within ten minutes of the hotel. WOW!!! The price for the room is right, from 79 euros and up and you can negotiate transportation to and from the airports if the times are slow. All in all, a wonderful stay at a good price. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't miss staying at the Hotel Apricot in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: annaustin
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from three nights in Istanbul at the Hotel Apricot. I'm so glad that I found this hotel for my visit. Communication was excellent from the first contact--Goskel was a fabulous host when we arrived. He provided suggestions on everything from what to visit (and when) to restaurants to safety. He repeatedly went out of his way to assure that our needs/wants were being met. It felt more like visiting a friend than staying in a hotel. The hotel could not be more convenient--only a five minute walk to the Blue Mosque, tram stop or the sea. Reasonable prices, fantastic service. Don't miss this one!

Reviews.Title: “Nice value boutique, good location,”
Reviews.Author: creige
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of our trip. It's in a great location, just down from a small market, behind the Blue Mosque. They have another new location, we didn't see that one. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The breakfasts are nice. Our room was a bit cramped but clean and quiet with a good shower. It was much cheaper than our place in Taxim. But you are in the tourist ghetto. This was a great little hotel for the price and one I would heartily recommend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “WOW !!!!!!!!!!!!! What a Wonderful Place”
Reviews.Author: wilolly
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this great B&B for 11 nights. Three nights in room 3 which had a great King size bed but the room was a bit small. .We spent 8 nights in room 1 which not only had a great King size bed but also a front room and a large bathroom with a Turkish tub. The room was a good size and we could unpack our suitcase into the wardrobe and our bathroom items in the bathroom cabinets. The breakfast was great and all the staff just so friendly and welcoming. Goksel,Ayse, and Cem made us all feel at home and were our guardian angels .It was near all the major sites but yet amazingly quiet at night.

Reviews.Title: “Best location and wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: pakhet
Reviews.Content: My friend & I stayed at the Apricot Hotel for 3 nights in February. The hotel is on a lovely cobble stone street about 5 minutes walk from the Blue Mosque, and only minutes walk to shops, restaurants & bazaars. From the hotel we were also able to walk to Haghia Sophia, Topkapi Palace and lots of other places - a very central location. Our room was small but quite adequate, clean & cozy. It was all we needed as we were out all day. The bed was very comfortable & breakfast was quite sufficient. The staff were wonderful & helped out with advice, arranged taxi's & arranged & took us to a Hamman. We couldn't fault our whole stay. We highly recommend this lovely little boutique hotel for affordability, location & service.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ikkikitty
Reviews.Content: For a small hotel with less than 10 rooms the staff goes all out for their guests including breakfast 2 hours early when we had an early flight, offering a refrigerator for our room, and providing us with fresh coffee or tea at any time we came in the door. I was also walked over to a carpet shop where I got a smoking deal on some carpets after I'd been looking all over Turkey. The rooms are small but they are honest about this on the website. Very comfortable hotel, super friendly staff, quiet street. I would recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: backpacktravelers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spend five nights here in Room 4. We had a spacious room and a nice bathroom. Our room was furnished with a double bed, a wardrobe, a small tv, a chair, and a love seat. The staff had good suggestions regarding sightseeing, restaurants and shopping. We were pleased with the location because most of the sights in the Old Town were an easy walk from the hotel. Our airport pickup went fine - no problems. The wi-fi worked fine as well - we were given one password that worked for our entire stay. In my opinion, the hotel's strong point is the friendly staff and the good breakfast. Goksel and Omar took very good care of us and we have already recommended this little hotel to friends of ours!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: rpcv73
Reviews.Content: If you can handle stairs the Apricot is run by very nice people who keep the rooms clean and serve a very nice breakfast in their very small dining room. Location, location, location...you can walk to everything from here. Washington, DC

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel, great staff and will definitely return”
Reviews.Author: canmom
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room # 2 at the Apricot Hotel from Dec. 04 â€“ Dec. 07th of 2009...This is a hotel that was recommended to me back in 2005 from a few friends that have stayed there and from that time on I too was also recommending it to others..so finally I got a chance to stay there myself. Situated in the old part of Istanbul ( the SultanAhmet area ) and just a few minutes to the Arasta Bazaar and Blue Mosque it is a wonderful location and the service and hospitality are excellent. Hakan the owner arranged for the shuttle to pick me up upon my arrival at Istanbul Ataturk airport. The shuttle was there waiting from me to arrive which I was very happy not to have to wait around. The driver was great and within about 30 minutes or so I was at the hotel were I check in and made my way to my room. The front clerks at the hotel ( Goksel and sorry cannot remember the other older manâ€™s name ) where extremely helpful and polite. They were always available to call you a taxi or help if needed. Also I should remember to thank the cleaning lady who was also very friendly and cleaned and made up my room everyday during my 3 nights spend there. Everything was perfect. The rooms are of standard size, comfy beds with ammenities such as TV, Wifi, telephone, small balconies and with a very large bathroom. And my room had a jacuzzi tub however I did not have any time to enjoy that pleasure. Some of the other rooms also have mini-bar fridges and a couch ( I had friends staying there as well in another room on the floor above me ) I had a room that faced the Blue mosque but because of a new building being built just behind the hotel I did not get a view of the Blue Moque except for one of the minarets..but that was not a concern for me because there are plenty of places in Sultanahmet to get fantastic views from above..plenty of restaurants and bars/pubs where you can access their terraces for a drink or two to enjoy the splended views. Breakfast was nice and in typical turkish style of of tomatoes, cucumbers, olives, cheeses, bread, fruit, etc.... Along with filter coffe available. Nice touch. While I was there there were a variety of guests staying at the hotel and I loved my chats with the lovely Singapore family with the 2 boys. The beauty of this hotel is the atmosphere that is created by not only the owner Hakan but the staff. A very family friendly and cozy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good but overpriced!”
Reviews.Author: sweetcheeks79705
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here, because of a review we read on Frommers.com. WARNING, the review on frommers is based on the old location of this hotel which had 16 rooms with view of the Blue Mosque. The current location of the Apricot only has 6 rooms and they are small without views. Don't get me wrong, the hotel is clean but it is TOO pricey. For half of what they charge you at the Apricot, you could stay at the Apex hotel next door or Aviecenna hotel across the street. You could also try the Side pension/hotel. All of the hotels provide cheaper prices, excellent value and clean rooms. After leaving the Apricot my husband and I stayed at the Apex and Side hotel for half the price!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: dinipro
Reviews.Content: I was on a three month tour of Asia and Europe, and this was the absolute last stop. I think my senses was dull by the time I reached Istanbul that I was not amazed by the city at all. In fact, I can say, I didn't care for the city much. I'll save that for another review. But I loved this hotel... mostly because the service was great here. As soon as we arrived, we were given a run down of the city, where everything is and how we could get to places, where to eat, where to avoid getting gypped. The front desk just acted like we were friends, and gave us the load down. The hotel is old, but kept very clean -- or as clean as you can for an old building. We stayed in room 5 for 3 nights, and was asked if we would mind switch to room 1 for one night. And we did, since the reception guys are so nice and friendly. Although, I did enjoy the bathroom in room 5 much more. Room 5 is on the third floor and had a balcony, but we never went outside. The view of the Blue mosque is blocked by a building and a construction site. Since both my friend and I are girls, and we've been ogled at all day by men, we were afraid to go outside in our pjs. The bathroom is very nice and has a hammas, but we didn't use it. But the shower was great after we figured out how to use it. Room 1 has a view of the street and is on the second floor. The street is very quaint, so I think I enjoyed the view in room 1 better. However, the bathroom just had a tub and not very well constructed one at that. It has a shower head, but no curtains. So when you take a shower, water get spilled everywhere. Kinda annoying. All the bedding is very comfortable, clean, and white. The queen size bed could be split into two smaller beds for non couples. Room 1 even has a sofa bed and living room (but very small one at that). Breakfast is excellent, I always had 2 helpings of yogurt. Internet is very slow, but it works for email and such. Basically, we enjoyed our stay there. It's no 5* hotel, but the service and people make up for it tremendously. I just hope you enjoy the city more than I did.

Reviews.Title: “delightful, friendly, helpful, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: KandNAustralia
Reviews.Content: we stayed in istanbul for 2 weeks, in the Apricot Hotel, room 5. loved having a balcony, enjoyed the view, found all the staff exceptionally helpful, friendly and knowledgable. Delightful place and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it. We also had our own hammam in our bathroom - terrific fun. the free secure wifi was also much appreciated. we will be back :-)

Reviews.Title: “Did not want to leave it!”
Reviews.Author: Ishtar11
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel, very well located in Istanbul. The staff was kind and helpfull, gave us many informations about where to go to eat and what to see. The room was clean, big bathroom with jacuzzi, nice breakfast... our stay was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “we came back”
Reviews.Author: dubiosicity
Reviews.Content: Great small hotel in the heart of Sutanhamet. It had everything we were looking for, friendly staff, good service, close to all the sights. Great coffee, fresh fruit and french toast for breakfast.Goksel on the front desk was brilliant, always willing to help, advise and assist. Thanks to his recommendation our 3 week trip around Turkey was amazing. Thanks Goksel.

Reviews.Title: “Apricot Was not My Husbands Cup of Apple Tea”
Reviews.Author: queenhelene
Reviews.Content: Made reservation based on comments here , great communication, very helpful. But when larrived place was run down, carpet torn on stairs, room, okay but od, but nice bathroom. View of Blue Mosque blocked partially by by brick building going up. I had same experiene that previous people did with pickup at airport, made us wait for over hour had to call several times. Nice helpful staff, but my husband didnt think it was good value for a old rundown hotel, no terrace, so after one night he walked across street to Avience and got room for 15Euros more, views of water, very nice. I think they need to put a little money into this place, and lower the price.

Reviews.Title: “So glad we picked this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jonibrock
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews here at tripadvisor, the Apricot seemed to offer everything we wanted...small hotel, run by friendly, helpful staff, in a quiet spot but very close to all the sights of Sultanhamet. We even chose our room based on the photos here. We stayed four nights and everything was even better than we hoped. Goksel on the front desk was brilliant, he will advise you or set up anything you need in Istanbul or beyond, we really felt we had made a friend in Istanbul. I know there are cheaper hotels nearby but we would choose the Apricot again. The breakfast also was particularly good, including good coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Very Average”
Reviews.Author: tbagpuss
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Apricot largely on the basis of reccommendations here on TA. I felt that the hotel, while adequate, was not as good value or as pleasant as I had hoped. I was due to be met at the airport, and had e-mailed the previous day to confirm my flight details and that I was arriving on a domestic, not international flight. There was no sign of anyone when I arrived at the airport and it took 2 hours and several calls to the hotel, with the help of the airport information service, to sort it out. On arriving at the hotel there was no apology or explanation, and the man at the desk spent the first 10 minutes trying to tell me which turkish bath to visit, before even letting me into the room! I was in room 5, which has a view of the Blue Mosque - it is a reasonable room - however, it is a little odd for a hotel room.- there was no nightstand or bedside chair (a very great disadvantage if, like me, you wear spectacles and need somewhere to put them at night!) There were lights above the bed separate from the main room light, but no way of turning them on or off. On the plus side, the bed was comfortable and the room warm (important, when visiting in december). The room did seem in need of redecorating - there were water stains on the ceiling. The bathroom appeared to have been recently redecorated - there was a fancy shower, plus the 'turkish bath' (marble seat plus tao & brass bowls) however, the shower had been rather inexpertly plumbed in, and there was visible wiring above the sink. I found the service very hit and miss, too. One day my room wasn't claned or made up at all, and on another I found the master set of keys which had been left in my bathroom, and apparently not missed, which did cause me to have doubts about the security of the hotel. Over all, I would say the hotel was adequate. It is well placed, within easy walking distance of the Blue Mosque & Hagia Sophia, but not particularly good value for money. It's fair to say that I was staying out of season, and Hakan, who I understand is the owner, was not there for much of the time, as he was apparently supervising building or renovation work elsewhere. Compared to other hotels I stayed at in Turkey I didn't feel the staff were particularly helpful. If I go back to Istanbul I shall stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: zekenz
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. It is in a cute boutique area with cobbled streets and lots of good restaurants. Only minutes walk from the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofya and a few more to the Grand Bazaar so location is spot on. We booked via email and the communication was always quick. We arrived late at night and was picked up from the airport as arranged. The staff at Apricot were always helpful with ideas of where to go sightseeing and where to eat. They were extremely patient with me as I constantly got money exchange rates wrong when talking with me. I was also impressed when the man on reception brought a big bowl of cherries for us while we waited at reception for some friends to meet us for dinner. We stayed in room #5 and the view was fantastic! The room was a decent size and the bathroom was large, the only thing was the drains did smell a little. But it was clean. The breakfast area is really cute with a big window to look over the street, Breakfast just the normal basic breaky stuff. We just can't wait to come back to Turkey and definately will be coming back to Apricot to stay. Tip: A fun place to go for a drink and/or some nibbles is Seven Hills Hotel (head towards the Blue Mosque from Apricot Hotel and at the artisans bazaar turn right, as if you are going to the Mosque but don't turn left, stay on that road and it is in the next block.) go in the elevator to the roof for the most fabulous view looking over the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofya and the ocean on the other side. (Great to go just before sunset)

Reviews.Title: “There are better options”
Reviews.Author: whitermco
Reviews.Content: My friends and I, after three weeks touring Turkey with Overseas Adventure Travelors, remained four nights in Istanbul. Disregarding the advise of our tour leader, two of my traveling companions got nervous and booked the Apricot by phone from Izmir. The hotel is really a dump. It is overpriced, not as advertised, stained wallpaper falling off stairwells and rooms, TV's barely work, showers difficult to operate, some rooms had no shower only a tub, business center is a decent computer in the basdement surrounded by lots of basement clutter. There was supposed to be a rooftop terrace with a view used for breakfast; it was being renovated and has been for what appeared to be years. Breakfast, very limited, was in the crowded lobby. Coffee was good. The employees, one during the day and one during the night were excellent, friendly, responsive to our needs. Location was okay. I will never stay in the Apricot Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “What more could we ask for”
Reviews.Author: chrismuz
Reviews.Content: Our stay in istanbull was amazing, hotel Apricot, was central to all sights (walking ) and some great restaurants, it is quaint, and personal. You can be in the thick of thousands of people and relax in a lovely hospitable hotel when you have had enough. Breakfast was always good, our rooms clean with lovely views of the blue mosque. Hakann, helped with so much and we hired a car on the last day with them and wera able to park accross the road, with Hakaan taking us in the morning on the motorway showing us the way out of istanbul, this made it so easy for us. For us you would not regret staying in this hotel, we will again some time. The hotel manager was lovely, and made our stay a very happy one. Thanks to you all for a time we will never forget

Reviews.Title: “Just Like Home”
Reviews.Author: Busy-retired
Reviews.Content: We spent six weeks tucked into this charming hotel. With a guest to staff ratio of 2:1, we always received plenty of attention and assistance with whatever it was we wanted to do. This hospitable staff knows what we need before we know we need it. This is a small boutique hotel, and it cannot be compared to a five star chain hotel. It is a plain and simple property. Nonetheless it boasts several unique and charming elements. We love the huge marble bathrooms, the little handmade soaps and the extra towels. Our room was immaculate. Small Turkish hotels do not have much storage room for clothing one would normally put in drawers, but there was a huge wardrobe that had room for everything we packed. Unlike the tiny rooms that are common to the boutiques of Sultanahmet we enjoyed a huge suite with a giant bedroom, huge bathroom and cozy sitting room. It was sufficiently large enough that we lived there for six weeks without annoying one another. English channels on the TV were appreciated, but the high-speed wireless internet connection provided us with even more evening entertainment. For guests who do not arrive with their own laptops, the Apricot provides a computer for guest use. Many rooms have stunning views of the Blue Mosque, and the location of the hotel is perfect. It is a block away from the bustling tourist area, but set on a quiet street with almost no street noises. The double-glazed windows block out the morning call to prayer so we have to crack open our window so we do not miss it. Free transportation from the airport to the hotel was in the form of a luxury van. The driver gave us cherry juice and cakes and endured our tortured Turkish on the drive from the airport. Breakfast is ample, and served well into the morning hours. Typical Turkish breakfast foods of tomatoes, cucumbers, olives, cheeses, bread, lovely, thick Turkish yogurt and sour cherry jam were augmented by a selection of fresh fruits, cereals, eggs, meats and drip-brewed coffee (which is almost impossible to find in Sultanahmet hotels). The hotel is lovely, but we stay here because of the staff. They are on duty 24/7 and ready to meet your every need. If it rains they provide umbrellas and carry them over your head until you tell them to return to the hotel. If you are hungry but too weary to eat out they will arrange delivery from good restaurants, and provide a table with china, silverware and crystal as well as attentive service. If you want to eat authentic Turkish food, they will guide you by the hand to tiny little corners in Sultanahmet where you can eat fish only hours away from the sea, or authentic Turkish meals prepared with some grandmother's favorite recipes. I cannot even begin to recount the unique services we received or that I saw other guests receive. You can expect that the owner Hakan, will do whatever is necessary to assist you with your experience whether that is making plane reservations to Cappadocia, driving you in his own car to the doctor or pharmacy, getting up in the middle of the night to make sure your internet connection is working, celebrating Valentines Day with a bouquet of flowers or driving you to some place you wish to shop or eat. Hakan is the most service--oriented person we have ever met. We had a customs problem. Omer drove us to the customs office and spent seven hours with us getting things worked out. Then he drove us back to the hotel. We used eight hours of his time and the hotel car and no one would accept any financial compensation. The day we left, Hakan arranged for a taxi to the airport. Then he and Omer followed us in his car. Hakan got out at the airport with us and stayed with us until our massive amounts of luggage had been checked by the airline. We did not touch a suitcase from the minute we entered Istanbul until after we left. In 2007 we first came to the Apricot as guests. Since then we have returned as family. I cannot imagine staying anywhere in Istanbul except in this tiny jewel of a hotel secure that regardless of what might happen to me in Istanbul, Hakan is only a phone call away. We are counting the days until we can return!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: TravelersFromNJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room number 2 at the Apricot on May 5 and 6, 2009, following a tour of Turkey. Our room was very nice with a spacious bathroom containing a whirlpool bath and a balcony containing a table and two chairs with a very good view of the Blue Mosque. Except for the call to prayer, it was very quiet. The Staff was extremely helpful, and the breakfast buffet small but good and more than ample. The hotel is in the old part of istanbul and it is very close to restaurants, a local bazaar and a variety of shops -- excellent location. We walked to the Great Mosque, the Spice Market, the Grand Bazaar, and other sites. Had dinner in a nearby small restaurant to which we were escorted by a hotel staffer, Goksel, to make sure we didn't get lost. This fish restaurant is run by a fisherman and serves custom cooked fish dishes. We had a very good Sea Bream dinner which included several Turkish dishes and a nice bottle of Turkish wine. Had a good lamb dinner at another nearby restaurant the next night. Can't think of how our stay could have been better. Good hotel, good staff, good location -- can't beat it!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Apricot is OK if you don't need a shower, toilet paper or a room”
Reviews.Author: seattlejazzbaby
Reviews.Content: Based on trip advisor reviews we made reservations at the Hotel Apricot for 3 nights at the beginning of our stay and 3 at the end. When we arrived in Istanbul, naturally tired from the long trip, we were asked to wait in the lobby without any explanation. After about an hour the owner appeared and said that the bathroom was being "re-marbled" and we could either wait until it was done (at 22:00) or go next door. We went next door to a basic room without the view or balcony we had reserved. The next morning we went back to the Apricot and still couldn't check into the room. After a day of sight seeing we finally were allowed into the room where we found that there was nowhere to put our clothes--no closets or drawers, and no hangers for the closet. There was a large water stain on the ceiling, rips in the wallpaper, and a very strong smell of cigars which never dissipated. There was even a dirty ashtray in the room! The bathroom did have beautiful new marble, however the shower did not have a shower curtain or shower door. Since this was our first hotel in Turkey, we thought it was like bathrooms in China and other places we have stayed that just don't have shower curtains. We learned the next day, however, that the door just hadn't been installed and they wanted us to use the "turkish bath" (a basis and 2 water taps) instead of the shower. Something that wasn't the hotel's fault, but still detracted from the experience, was the excavation going on across the street which was noisy and was part of the "view" of the blue mosque. The location was good, however, and the person at the desk was very friendly and between my approximately 50 words of Turkish and his similar amount of English we were able to communicate enough to do things like pay the bill and find out where the internet connection was located. Although other reviews mentioned that the owner was very friendly and helpful, we really couldn't speak as to that one way or the other as he was not around except when telling us that our room was unavailable--which he did without any apology or real explanation. (We ran into other travellers later on during our trip who had a similar experience with Hotel Apricot. Another hotel owner told us that the Apricot is known to intentionally overbook rooms in case some of the people with reservations don't show up.) When we came back to Istanbul for another 3 nights, we arrived at the hotel to find that there was no toilet paper. My husband went down from the 3rd to the 1st floor and asked for some and was told they were out. Luckily we had some tissues with us. The shower still didn't have a curtain or door and the shower head was leaky, spraying even more water all over the bathroom. The promised wake up call for our early departure for the airport never materialized but by this point we weren't relying too heavily on the Apricot and had set both cell phones on alarm to wake us up. I was really surprised, based on the strong reviews this hotel got from others, that it was so mediocre--not terrible, just nothing special. Everywhere else we went we received better service and had much nicer rooms and overall very positive experiences. With the exception of the Apricot, I would heartily recommend any of the hotels we stayed at in Turkey. As for the Apricot, I think there must be better places in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Room is Simple - but the location, the view and the Staff - THE BEST!”
Reviews.Author: RuralLiving
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in early April at the Apricot Hotel - and it was wonderful! The room, as others have mentioned, is a bit simple, and while we were there the shower doors were being replaced - so taking a shower was a bit interesting, but.... We had the fabled room #5 - What a view! When we first opened the curtains and saw the Blue Mosque towering above us we immediatly rushed out to the balcony to soak it in. Then when we first heard the call to prayer - we were mesmerized! It was so neat how when the singer from the Blue Mosque would get to the end of a phrase and pause, you would hear the other mosques in the city echoing his final notes. It was with out question the best view in town! We arrived after dark on a cold rainy night - actually about 1 hour before Barak Obama's visit to Istanbul. Police/military personnel guarded the entire route from the air port - it made us feel special! When we arrived, cold, wet and tired, Hakan and his staff quickly helped us to our room and then helped us order take out from the Doy Doy restaurant near by - then arranged for it to be delivered! It was very much above the normal service one would expect. I just can't say enough wonderful things about the staff. Every day they assisted us in planning our activities (including how to avoide the area's President Obama was visiting our first day). They did our laundry - and every day our room was spotlessly cleaned. Each time we would pass the reception desk I would attempt "Thank you" in Turkish. Everytime they would laugh with me and give me the correct pronunciation. I never did learn to say it right. Forutnately the majority of people we met in Turkey clearly understood the English words. The room was sufficient in size for our group of 3 (my husband and 12 year old daughter and I). Other than the before mentioned problem of a lack of a shower door, the bathroom was very nice. The turkish bath in room 5 was great for when we just wanted a quick clean up rather than hosing down the entire bathroom. I'm sure the shower door issue is fixed now - so please - don't let this comment sway your decision. The Apricot Hotel is wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brinoabroad
Reviews.Content: We spent our first 3 nights in Turkey here and loved it. The staff were helpful, arranged for airport pick up and helped out with further travel plans. The top floor room was plain, but clean, and had a lovely view of the blue mosque. Breakfast every morning was a delight on the rooftop terrace with eggs cooked to order (instead of the requisite hard boiled egg I had every morning for the remainder of my month in Turkey!) On return to Istanbul after touring Turkey we chose not to stay here, only because we found similar hotels for quite a bit less. A lovely place overall, but a bit over-priced.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Henrietta_Stackpole
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Apricot for a week in March. One night was in one of the two smaller rooms, and then the owner upgraded us for no extra charge to room #2. For 49 euro a night, we had a comfortable bed, plenty of heat, a whirlpool bath, a free airport pickup, and a tasty breakfast. Oh, and a fantastic view of the Blue Mosque. The location was ideal to walk to the sites in the old city. The only drawback to the area (certainly not the fault of the hotel) was the agressive and relentless tactics of the rug merchants and restaraunts in the area). The smaller room that we stayed in for one night did have a musty smell, but not the larger room. Altogether I would say this is a great deal. The staff at the Apricot also provided good advice for site seeing and place to eat.

Reviews.Title: “The View Alone Is Worth The Price”
Reviews.Author: HelmutSchnitzel
Reviews.Content: Most of the reviews talk about how nice the hotel is or how great the view is...both are correct. I stayed here for a long weekend over New Years in room number 5. Room itself could use a little update, the paint is chipping, there was some water damage on the ceiling, and the water in the shower had trouble maintaining its temperature. However, the bathroom was large, the room was clean, all the decorations were very nice, and of course the view. We had a small balcony that looked right out to the Blue Mosque. Words can't do justice. The mosque is beautiful and its presence is as much a part of the room as the bed or the carpets. The call to prayer is so loud it might as well be coming from a man on the balcony yelling into a bullhorn. While some might be put off by the thunderous chanting at 6am to me it was an unforgettable cultural experience. If you go to Istanbul to experience the real city, this is probably the hotel for you. Both the owner and the other people working at the hotel are very nice. They could not have been more helpful or friendlier. They went out of their way several times to help us out. The hotel itself is very pleasant as well, on charming street in a great neighborhood, well within walking distance of important and historic sites. I would definitely recommend Istanbul as a vacation destination, and I would definitely recommend this hotel. Bottom line, the view alone is worth every penny youâ€™ll spend on the room. Note â€“ I donâ€™t think every room has a viewâ€¦but I know number 5 does.

Reviews.Title: “Truly wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: rose1403
Reviews.Content: Everything said about the Apricot is true, it is indeed a lovely hotel to stay at.
