For a very decent price you get a decent sized room 5 min walk to the Blue Mosque and three minutes walk to the Arasta Bazaar. The beds are wonderfully comfortable, with linens changed every day or two, and each room is climate controlled. the bathrooms are done in wood and marble, with the best shower I have ever experienced, and a turkish bath to experiment with if you don't feel inclined to visit a public one. The owner Hakan is truly charming, and even drove me across town to find an open pharmacy on a public holiday in the middle of the night to buy medecine for one of our party who was ill.

Reviews.Title: “It's the view, stupid”
Reviews.Author: Exscribe
Reviews.Content: There probably are at least 100 budget hotels in Istanbul comparable to the Apricot. So why then is this hotel mentioned in all the top guide books. My guess is the reason is Hakan, the owner. He has charm to spare and probably has courted every guide book author into including his establishment in their listings. What's interesting, though, is that none of those books specifically mentions the major selling point of the Apricot, something I learned about from previous reviews in tripadvisor. Two of his rooms, No. 2 and No. 5, have unobstructed views of the Blue Mosque. Other hotels may boast of their Blue Mosque view, but inevitably it is from an outdoor roof-top restaurant or breakfast room. That means you have to be fully dressed and prepared to brave inclement weather. If you are in No. 5, which is on the top floor (warning, no elevator), you can see the Blue Mosque from your bed or step out onto the balcony in a robe. This alone is worth the room price. Speaking of which, the Apricot is a budget hotel and on or off-season you will not be paying much for that view. Understand, though, that this IS a budget hotel. So the entry to the Apricot in wet weather includes negotiating astroturf and towels laid down over the mud, the check-in desk is miniscule, the breakfast area humble, and the gratus spread, well, if you like baloney, the lone meat, you're in luck. Still, that's no big deal. Hakan is a pleasant, informative host, and, if you're lucky to snag No. 5, a great trip to Istanbul is almost guaranteed.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and conveniently-located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Larry100
Reviews.Content: Everything positive written in Tripadvisor is correct. The location of Apricot is superb -- close to the vast majority of popular sites. The rooms are comfortable and clean. Breakfast is fresh and good. The street is quiet except for the early morning call to prayers from the Blue Mosque which is just around the corner (after a few days you sleep through it). Avoid the two small rooms -- they are a bit too small for an extended stay. Hakan and Omer -- the management and staff -- went out of their way to make our stay a real experience, e.g. a loan of 100 lira on the night we arrived so that we could have dinner, detailed explanations about where to eat and what to do and how to get there.

Reviews.Title: “Best View Ever!”
Reviews.Author: usingRpoints
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with our 14 yr. old daughter stayed at the Apricot for 1 week. We chose this hotel based on TI reviews, location, and price and we were not disappointed. After some hesitation (difficulty in getting a reply to email confirmation) regarding our initial reservation, we could not have been happier. Hakan and his assistant were very helpful and proved all their supporters to be true. We found the Apricot charming. Absolutely the best thing about our room was the view of the Blue Mosque, so beautiful while lit at night. Usually I do not have difficulty falling asleep, but did not want to close my eyes to that impressive sight! We could lay in bed and it was the last thing we saw before going to sleep and the first thing we saw in the morning. Also stunning at dawn, and then..... that wondrous call to prayer. Everything after that was just the icing. Yes, the breakfast was basic, but delicious and fresh. The dining area is small, but with a lovely window overlooking the street. All sights are close, easily within walking distance. My daughter and I never felt unsafe or threatened while out walking together. Rooms were clean and bathroom large and functional. Although the room was described as small when a triple, we found it fine for us and very nice to have the balcony. Once arrived in Istanbul, we often experienced that famous Turkish hospitality and in the near future I will submit more on that in the TI Forum. As guests of Mr. Basaran Ulusoy's "TURSAB" travel agency, we were fortunate to have had many meals and services provided to us, therefore did not need to take advantage of Hakan's wealth of knowledge. He did however, suggest a restaurant with a rooftop terrace (Doy-Doy) on our free day which we enjoyed very much and was reasonably priced. He also provided efficient transportation to the airport upon our departure. We were especially taken with Hakan's young son and enjoyed hearing him recite the English he had learned in school. What a charmer. The great photos shown on the previous review for the Apricot and room #5 are a true representation so I see no need to duplicate those. They capture the comfortable feeling of this hotel, although nothing can truly express the beauty and warm hospitality of Istanbul. We have stayed in many different types of places in several countries, and I have to say that my favorite "view from a room" is definately the Blue Mosque, room #5 , The Apricot Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Apricot was excellent”
Reviews.Author: zizumum
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research on sultanahmet hotels before choosing the hotel for my istanbul trip. Since I was accompanied by my toddler son, few things were on priority. 1. I should be close to the main tourist spots 2. I should be close to the tramline 3. I should be close to the train station 4. The location where i stay, should not be on a crowded street so as to avoid any disturbances at night 5. The hotel manager/staff should be able to guide us and give us recommendations etc. Whew, long wish list, but I tell you, i got all this and more at the Apricot. The hotel fulfilled all my requirements. The main attractions were a 5 mins walk, the tramline less then 10. The room was quite spacious neat and clean. The bathroom was so big with a turkish bath. The shower had good pressure. The room lights even had a dimmer. I chose room no5, which had a fabulous view of the blue mosque. It was so beautiful at night. The room also had a balcony with 2 chairs and a table. The rooms were sound proofed, and even that wasnt necessary, since it was so nice and quite outside, necessary for my son who sleeps at 8. Lots of nice restaurants in the nearyby Akbiyik street. But the best thing Apricot has is its manager Hakan, he is such a helpful guy. He took time out everyday to plan out our day, and used to guide us as to how to reach our destination and back. He even gave us good tips on where to shop, and bargaining tactics etc. He also took us one day to a baklave shop, (Karakoy gullugolu) which is an excellent pastry shop (highly recommended) Once we were getting late for the whirling dervishes ceremony at Sirkeci train station, he got us dropped off in his own car. Since we stayed there for 7 nights we got free pick and drop from the airport. Hakan speaks very good english and he alongwith his hardworking colleague Omar makes sure that we are right at home. Breakfast was served in the reception area, although they are working on making a small garden at the back of the hotel.The breakfast was served at 8:00am, but it was very basic, cheese, olives, tomatoes, cucumber, butter and bread. Cereal too. Oh one thing i forgot to mention, you get 2 english channels on tv, CNN and BBC Prime. All in all, Aprioct was a great experience, thank you to all the forumites who gave me good advice on selecting Apricot. We are definitely going to go back there next time we visit Istanbul. Things that i love about Aprioct: The view from the balcony. Specially at night. Hakan, the helpful manager and Omar his assistant. Things that i didnt like: Well, not many just one. This hotel is not fit for people with walking disabilites, since there were steep stairs to reach our room.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Apricot Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2gnomesinparis
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our daughter recently stayed at the Hotel Apricot. The hotel is in a great position and is within easy walking distance of all the sites of old Istanbul. The hotel is an older style charming little hotel. The beds were very comfortable. The breakfast was good and was usually boiled eggs, cheese, olives, apricots, yoghurt, cereal, bread, jam , cold meat tea/coffee. The best thing about the hotel was Omar who looked after us while we were there. He was so charming kind and helpful it was a pleasure to meet him. We would definately stay here again. Jenny & Dave Sydney Australia

HotelInfo.Name: Apricot Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Amiral Tafdil Sok No. 18 | Sultanahmet, Istanbul 34400, Turkey
